meanings.definition: The upper part of the human body, containing the brain and the eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and jaws.
meanings.sent1: She bumped her head on the door frame.
meanings.sent2: The baby has a soft spot on its head.
meanings.sent3: He shook his head in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The idea popped into her head out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The head of the table was reserved for the guest of honor.

meanings.definition: The front, top, or upper part of something.
meanings.sent1: The head of the bed was against the wall.
meanings.sent2: The head of the line reached the ticket counter first.
meanings.sent3: The head of the arrow was sharp and pointed.
meanings.sent4: The head of the mountain was covered in snow.
meanings.sent5: The head of the document contained the title and date.

meanings.definition: The person in charge of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The head of the company made an important decision.
meanings.sent2: The head of the team led them to victory.
meanings.sent3: The head of the household managed the finances.
meanings.sent4: The head of the committee organized the event.
meanings.sent5: The head of the school greeted the students every morning.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a department or division within an organization.
meanings.sent1: The head of the marketing department approved the campaign.
meanings.sent2: The head of the IT division fixed the network issue.
meanings.sent3: The head of the sales team exceeded the monthly target.
meanings.sent4: The head of the HR department conducted interviews.
meanings.sent5: The head of the finance division managed the budget efficiently.

meanings.definition: The top or leading position in a competition or organization.
meanings.sent1: She aimed to be the head of the class this semester.
meanings.sent2: The head of the leaderboard changed frequently during the race.
meanings.sent3: The head of the tournament received a trophy.
meanings.sent4: The head of the company was a visionary leader.
meanings.sent5: The head of the organization set ambitious goals for the team.
